question_text: Which of the following is the primary cause of lung cancer in non-smokers?
option_a: Genetic mutations leading to abnormal cell division
option_b: Exposure to radon gas and secondhand smoke

question_text: Which part of the human brain is primarily responsible for regulating body temperature?
option_a: Hypothalamus

question_text: What is the main function of the spleen in the human body?
option_a: Filter blood and recycle iron from red blood cells
option_c: Produce white blood cells for the immune response

question_text: Which of the following structures in the human body is responsible for the exchange of gases during respiration?
option_a: Alveoli

question_text: In which part of the human body would you find the largest concentration of lymph nodes?
option_a: Neck

question_text: Which of the following is a characteristic of the parasympathetic nervous system?
option_a: It slows heart rate and promotes digestion
option_b: It increases heart rate and dilates pupils
option_c: It triggers the 'fight or flight' response

question_text: What is the function of the enzyme lipase in the human digestive system?
option_a: Breaking down fats into fatty acids and glycerol
option_b: Breaking down proteins into amino acids
option_c: Breaking down carbohydrates into simple sugars

question_text: Which of the following is the most significant effect of aging on the immune system?
option_a: Decreased production of new T-cells and B-cells

question_text: What causes the condition known as scurvy?
option_a: Deficiency of Vitamin C

question_text: Which of the following is most commonly associated with the development of Type 1 diabetes?
option_a: Autoimmune destruction of insulin-producing beta cells in the pancreas
option_b: Increased resistance to insulin in the body's cells
option_c: Overproduction of insulin in the pancreas
option_d: Defective glucose uptake by muscle cells

question_text: In an action potential, what occurs during the depolarization phase?
option_a: Sodium channels open, allowing sodium ions to flow into the cell
option_b: Potassium channels open, allowing potassium ions to flow out of the cell
option_c: Chloride channels open, allowing chloride ions to flow into the cell
option_d: Sodium and potassium ions switch places across the membrane

question_text: Which of the following is the primary method by which oxygen is transported in the blood?
option_a: Bound to hemoglobin in red blood cells

question_text: Which organ is responsible for filtering the blood and producing urine?
option_a: Kidneys

question_text: Which of the following is an autoimmune disease?
option_a: Multiple sclerosis

question_text: Which of the following is a function of the large intestine?
option_a: Absorption of water and electrolytes from indigestible food matter
option_b: Secretion of digestive enzymes for protein breakdown
option_d: Storage of bile for fat digestion

question_text: Which type of white blood cell is most important for the body's defense against viral infections?
option_a: T lymphocytes

question_text: Which structure of the human heart receives deoxygenated blood from the body?
option_a: Right atrium

question_text: What is the primary role of the liver in carbohydrate metabolism?
option_a: Converting excess glucose to glycogen for storage
option_b: Breaking down glucose for energy production

question_text: Which of the following is the result of the activation of the renin-angiotensin system?
option_a: Increased blood pressure

question_text: Which of the following hormones is responsible for stimulating milk production in females?
option_a: Prolactin

question_text: What is the main cause of cystic fibrosis?
option_a: Defect in the CFTR gene leading to faulty chloride ion transport
option_b: Deficiency of the enzyme amylase in the pancreas
option_d: Defective insulin production in the pancreas

question_text: Which of the following is the most common cause of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)?
option_a: Cigarette smoking

question_text: What happens during the process of synaptic transmission in the nervous system?
option_a: Neurotransmitters are released into the synaptic cleft and bind to receptors on the post-synaptic neuron
option_b: Electrical impulses jump across the synapse to the next neuron
option_c: Myelin sheaths speed up the electrical impulses across synapses
option_d: Neurotransmitters are absorbed back into the pre-synaptic neuron after binding to receptors

question_text: Which of the following is the function of the pituitary gland?
option_a: Secretes hormones that regulate growth, reproduction, and metabolism

question_text: Which of the following cells is responsible for the production of antibodies?
option_a: B lymphocytes

question_text: What is the most common cause of a stroke?
option_a: Disruption of blood flow to the brain due to a clot or hemorrhage
option_c: Compression of the brain by a tumor
option_d: Low blood pressure causing brain ischemia

question_text: Which part of the human immune system provides the first line of defense against pathogens?
option_a: Skin and mucosal barriers

question_text: How does the body compensate for a decrease in blood oxygen levels?
option_a: Increased erythropoietin production to stimulate red blood cell production
option_b: Increased blood flow to the lungs to improve gas exchange
option_c: Increased breathing rate to enhance oxygen intake

question_text: Which of the following is most commonly associated with sickle cell anemia?
option_a: Mutation in the hemoglobin gene causing deformed red blood cells
option_b: Lack of oxygen supply leading to white blood cell production
option_c: Excessive iron build-up in the blood
option_d: Deficiency of hemoglobin in red blood cells

question_text: Which of the following best describes the function of the enzyme amylase?
option_a: Breaking down starch into simple sugars
option_b: Breaking down fats into fatty acids and glycerol
option_c: Breaking down proteins into amino acids
option_d: Breaking down nucleic acids into nucleotides

question_text: Which of the following causes the release of histamine during an allergic reaction?
option_a: Activation of mast cells by allergens

question_text: What is the primary function of the lymphatic system?
option_a: Transporting lymph, nutrients, and waste materials throughout the body
option_d: Transporting hormones produced by the endocrine glands

question_text: Which condition is associated with a deficiency of vitamin D?
option_a: Rickets

question_text: What is the cause of Down syndrome?
option_a: An extra copy of chromosome 21
option_b: A mutation in the CFTR gene
option_d: A mutation in the APC gene

question_text: Which of the following hormones is responsible for regulating the sleep-wake cycle?
option_a: Melatonin
